abstract: South Korean's former first lady Lee Hee-ho visits North Korea, causing analysts to wonder if trip is meant to improve relations between two countries; Lee, who is visiting without any official government employees or official proposals, is widow of Kim Dae-jung, former president whose promotion of positive engagement with North has been criticized by South Korea's current conservative leadership.
lead_paragraph: Lee Hee-ho, whose late husband championed reconciliation, was not carrying any official message, but her delegation hoped the visit would inspire more dialogue.

headline.main: Former First Lady of South Korea Visits Pyongyang in Good-Will Trip
headline.print_headline: Widow of a Former South Korean President Pays a Visit to the North

snippet: Lee Hee-ho, whose late husband championed reconciliation, was not carrying any official message, but her delegation hoped the visit would inspire more dialogue.
